def_cn: 肤浅的;浅薄的;粗枝大叶的
def_en: If you describe someone as superficial, you disapprove of them because they do not think deeply, and have little understanding of anything serious or important.

def_cn: (行动、情感、关系)表面的，外表的，不深入的
def_en: If you describe something such as an action, feeling, or relationship as superficial, you mean that it includes only the simplest and most obvious aspects of that thing, and not those aspects which require more effort to deal with or understand.

def_cn: 表面的，乍看起来的(尤指实际并非如此)
def_en: Superficial is used to describe the appearance of something or the impression that it gives, especially if its real nature is very different.

def_cn: (伤势或伤害)表层的，表皮的，表面的
def_en: Superficial injuries are not very serious, and affect only the surface of the body. You can also describe damage to an object as superficial .
The superficial layers of the skin are the ones nearest the surface.
